ABOUT THE COMPANY  
 
Oxford Immunotec  is a global, commercial -stage diagnostics company that provides innovative tests 
in the field of infectious disease and immunology. We are pionee rs in measuring the T cell part of the 
human immune system. Oxford Immunotec is part of the PerkinElmer group of companies.   
 
Oxford Immunotec’s  primary test is the T -SPOT®.TB test, a class -leading test for detecting latent 
tuberculosis. Tuberculosis is the leading cause of infectious disease death globally, and a top ten killer 
for humankind. 10 million people develop Active TB disease a year, of which approximately 1.6 millio n 
will die, including 250,000 children.  
 
As we lack an effective vaccine against TB, our ability to control and eventually eradicate TB replies on 
screening for carriers of TB (so -called Latent Tuberculosis Infection – LTBI) followed by administration 
of preventative antibiotic treatment to those infected.  
 
LTBI screening is already a cornerstone of TB control in the developed world, and there is increasing 
global public health mobilization to bring the benefits of TB screening and preventative treatment to less 
developed countries. For example, the UN has declared its intent to get another 30 million people onto 
preventative treatment by 2022.  
 
The T -SPOT. TB test is a relatively new blood test for detecting TB infection, designed to replace the 
antiquate d Tuberculin Skin Test (TST) that has hitherto been used for this purpose. The advantages of 
T-SPOT. TB are numerous, including greater accuracy, quicker turnaround and a strong health 
economic case. The T -SPOT. TB test has regulatory approval in over 50 cou ntries worldwide (including 
the US, Europe, China and Japan), is supported by over 500 peer -reviewed scientific publications and 
is recommended in guidelines in over 40 countries. The T -SPOT. TB test is named as one of the 100 or 
so Essential Diagnostics by  the WHO to which every country in the world should have access. Over 20 
million T -SPOT. TB tests have been sold globally and somebody in the world receives a T -SPOT. TB 
test about every 8 seconds.  
 
This test has a global market opportunity greater than $1 billion in revenue per year. Despite the 
success of the company to date, the prospects for continued growth of T -SPOT. TB are stronger than 
ever. This is driven by both external and internal factors. Externally, the outlook for market growth is 
robust both as guidelines increasingly favour blood testing over the TST and due to the expansion of 
the market as more TB screening programs are established worldwide. Internally, the company is rolling 
out a major new product innovation cycle to expand the clinical utility and improve workflow of the T -
SPOT®.TB test both of which will further improve uptake.  
 
In developing the T -SPOT. TB test, the company has generated world -leading expertise in the functional 
measurement of the T cell part of the immune system.  
 
The company is playing a leading role in the COVID19 pandemic. We have been chosen by the UK 
government to support the approval  and deployment of COVID19 vaccines, by providing critical 
information on how and whether the vaccines produce an effective immune response. Additionally, the 
Company has recently launched its T -SPOT. COVID  test; a test to measure T cell immunity to SARS -
CoV-2. This test has wide application and is being made available around the world.  
 
Our Vision is to significantly grow the Company through both organic new product development (via 
R&D) and inorganically through acquisition. PerkinElmer is keen to support us in this Vision through 
supporting the acquisition of additional companies in the immunology and infectious disease space, 
using Oxford Immunotec as a foundation around which to build.
